text:
So query wise I am looking to do this process:

1. Get all possible properties on an object (request 1)
2. Read through them and decide which ones I wanted (logic handled on my end)
3. Specifically ask for the ones I've decide to request in action 2 (request 2)
I am mainly having trouble with action 1

Is there any way to do action 1 in the first request, so I can dynamically choose which ones I want in request 2?

The 3rd action: is fine if I in my specify which ones as you proposed, but if i am trying to ask for a group, or 5 random, etc. i dont get anything.

Hi! I'm using HubSpot import api and there are some columns whose values should not be overwritten. It's working using UI but not when using import API. I've already set "skipIfKnownColumn": *true*  in the column mapping but values still gets overwritten. Any ideas as to why?

Hi all!

How do we test the filters on searchApi.doSearch()?
We're trying to create a test to ensure that the filters are filtering the right objects. Do you guys have any experience in creating mock for this?
did anyone found a solution for using HubSpot serverless functions on non HubSpot hosted pages?
I developed a form validation that should run from a non HubSpot hosted page and I get the CORS error
I found some answers in the community about using a HubSpot hosted proxy page to invoke my lambda/serverless function

Hello, everyone,

Guys I'm close to creating my first Webhook, I've done some research and I've come up with a few options to test locally on HubSpot. I'm between installing and using ngrok or uploading to heroku. If anyone can give me some advice on which is better, I'd be very grateful
Hey. I have issue with `crm/v3/objects/line_items` Products props are not inherited

Price, name, etc are not inherited from product
`hs_object_id` is product id
According to docs this should work <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/objects/products#create-and-associate-a-line-item-single-call>
ngrok free plan should be enough

So I can understand what I did now David, but it actually increases the confusion....
I originally took an emailId, threadID and messageID from an existing helpdesk ticket an set that in the API call as above. And that does work.
Utterly useless, but it work.
You can set the threadID and messageID to whatever you like, does not have to be unique.
But somewhere there is a relationship between the value of the messageID / ThreadID and the email.
I honestly can't find where.
I did run a full query through all properties in GraphQL, but there is no match to those values.
Spooky actions. Sorry i can't be more helpful.

My intention is to migrate existing Zendesk tickets and I’ll have to create everything from scratch, so linking to something that already exists doesn’t quite cut it.  I’ll have to experiment some more too see if I can find a way.
I have already tested a 3rd party tool, but they cannot migrate into conversations - only emails and notes, which means the help desk view is empty for those tickets.
Thank you for your help.

Hey everyone,

Just following up on my previous post regarding the issue with tracking Google and Facebook leads after the recent API shift. We haven't received any feedback yet and would really appreciate your insights or suggestions on how to resolve this. Has anyone else faced similar issues or found a workaround?

Also, is there a *Discord* community for HubSpot? If so, please let us know.

Thanks in advance for your help!
Have you considered import2 to partner with? If anyone has this all figured out it will be them.
